column4: Hey, I'm using the Korn shell and I'm having trouble with my environment variables such as $MAIL. They keep getting purged when I close Xterm. Is there a way I can make them stick around?
any takers?
add them to $HOME/.bashrc
is there a specific place I should put that?
anywhere in .bashrc (or .kshrc, whichever is correct),   export MAIL=/var/spool/mail
I made up the value of MAIL, but you know what I mean
so if I want fetchmail to send the stuff to ~/Mail, then let procmail sort it, $MAIL should still be ~/Mail?
I would have to check the fetchmail docs, but most likely.
you can specify a mailbox explicitly with fetchmail, which is a better option
in my .fetchmailrc?
for delivery location?  yes, in the rc file
I guess I was doing it the lazy way...
nothing wrong with the lazy way in this case.  I just prefer setting it explicitly.  nothing to remember.
Where exactly should that go? I have the "poll server" line, setting the protocol, giving the username and passwd, a line for decoding MIME, and a line to tell fetchmail where procmail is.
that's all you need, then.  if $MAIL is used, procmail will be using it.
But $MAIL is busted.
didn't realize you were using procmail.  You do already have an explicit destination, albeit a logical one
then you have to look at its interaction with procmail, not fetchmail
assuming that procmail does receive the message.
might want to set up webadmin
webadmin?
w00t. I just sent an email to myself via webmail, then called fetchmail, and it ended up in the folder I wanted it to.
